subject: Deadzone issue with Manager software
description_text:
Hi,
I have the Simsonn Pro pedals plugged into the Plus X Control Box. I have set up the deadzones in the software, but iRacing does not recognise this. I have tried recalibration and setting the deadzones again, but iRacing still ignores it. I cannot get 100% throttle.
Can you please help?
-Vinnie

conversations.body_text: Hi Vinh Nguyen,  After connecting all three pedals, please unplug and reinsert the USB. Then, in the Simsonn Manager interface, click Offset to reset the offset and complete the pedal calibration. After calibration, please note that iRacing has special requirements — you will also need to recalibrate the pedals within the game settings.      Please note: iRacing requires an additional in-game calibration — all axes must be calibrated to an output value of 4095.

Thanks for responding,
I was still having the issue, but I seem to have resolved it by adding even more deadzone. The only issue I have now is with signal noise. When holding the Throttle or Clutch, I get a bit of noise which bounces around the input by a couple of %. It's not too bad on the Brake. I have grounded the control box to the sim rig and added ferrite chokes to all the cables, but I still have noise. Not sure if there is anything else that can be done.
Thanks!
-Vinnie
